result.execSummary:
The defendant Jason F Jones was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Burglary-Building or Dwelling [Modifiers: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime], a class F felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.10(1m)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Racine County Clerk of Circuit Court

miscConds.notes: Statutory costs assessed.   If supervision is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and governmental entities for the balance due.  Collections may include income assignment.

No alcohol or controlled substances except by prescription. Random UA's are authorized. Any counseling deemed appropriate by agent; specifically AODA assessment, treatment and after care and cognitive intervention. Must obtain and maintain full time verifiable employment. Must comply with child support and family court orders.   Defendant must submit a DNA sample as required by law unless sample previously provided, however, defendant must pay mandatory DNA surcharge. Firearm warning given Voting is prohibited until sentence is complete and civil rights have been restored. Defendant must obey all rules and regulations while on supervision.

timeConds.notes:
**AMENDED 1-11-2017:  Huber privileges are revoked.**
Huber is granted for employment. Do not report late or under the influence of alcohol or controlled substances except by prescription. Absolute sobriety is required.

Court Reporter: Pat Phinisee.  Defendant Jason F Jones in court with attorney Lori Ann Kuehn.  Chris D Steenrod appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  

State has no additions or corrections to PSI.  Defense has no additions or corrections to PSI.  

State Rec:  15CF1513 - Burglary:  follow PSI.  15CF1763 - B.J.:  follow PSI.
Statement by Attorney Kuehn.  Statement by Def.  

BTC:  15CF1513 - Burglary:  7 yrs total, 4 years WSP,  3 yrs ext supervision, I&S, 3 yrs prob, no alc or c/s, random UA's, AODA, counseling, cog intervention, F.T. employment.  Comply with Child Support, Family Court Orders.  Serve 4 months jail.  Huber Law.  Report 12-17-16.  
15CF1763:  B.J.:  4 yrs total, 2 yrs WSP, 2 yrs ext. supervision, I&S 3 yrs prob.  same conditions.  Concurrent with 15CF1513.
F.A. Warning given.  Voter Rights given.  Pay all Ct Costs & fees.
Racine County Alternatives Program

Charges per attached criminal complaint. Conditions:   No contact with the victims, TJ (person, property, residence or family).   No contact with the co-defendant, BM.  You have been ordered to have to provide a DNA sample as a condition of your bond.  Report to the Sheriff's Office Records Bureau. Hours:  Monday through Friday between 9:00 a.m. and 11:30 a.m.   Defendant to be placed on GPS monitor through Zimmerman Consulting Inc. (ZCI), 524 Main Street, 3rd floor, (262-632-1780). Exceptions are going to court and meeting w/his Atty.
*AMENDED 10-22-15:   TO ALLOW DEFENDANT TO ATTEND HEALTHCARE APPOINTS AND TO GO TO WORK*

**AMENDED 09-21-2016:  DEFENDANT TO BE RELEASED TO RACINE COUNTY ALTERNATIVES PROGRAM ONCE GPS UNIT HAS BEEN RETURNED TO THEIR OFFICE.  Bond to continue then as it was but Court reiterates 1) GPS unit to be worn at all times, 2) MUST be fully charged 3) and payment plan in writing. **

Court Reporter: Jennifer Schmaling. Defendant Jason F Jones in court with attorney Lori Ann Kuehn.  Chris D Steenrod appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  on State's motion to amend bond.
Per State, numerous violations, requests increased bond to $2000 on each file.  Is not paying for GPS.
Per Defense, defendant was hospitalized for mental condition, wants bond to continue as is.

BTC:  GPS unit needed.  Bond to continue as is if 1) GPS is worn at all times and 2) it is fully charged 3) payment plan in writing. Compliant or violation and back in.
